summary: In this context, methylsulfanylmethane (MT) and methane are related through their roles in volatile organic sulfur compound (VOSC) formation in freshwater ecosystems. The study indicates a strong correlation between the concentrations of MT and DMS (dimethyl sulfide) with the rate of methane production and sulfide levels in sediments. This suggests that MT may play a significant role in the microbial processes that lead to methane formation in these environments.
